definition: to know/to recognize/to be familiar with/to get acquainted with sb/knowledge/understanding/awareness/cognition
epistemology (in philosophy, the theory of how we know things)

sentences.english: I'm very pleased to meet you, the matron said, I'm his mother!
sentences.chinese: 很高兴认识你，护士长说，我是他的母亲。

sentences.english: He bought an English-Chinese dictionary in order to look up the words he doesn't know.
sentences.chinese: 他买了本英汉字典，以便查找他不认识的单词。

sentences.english: He said that his nickname is "Toshomen, " you want to know her?
sentences.chinese: 他说自己的外号是“刀削面”，你想认识她吗？

sentences.english: Nick: Excuse me. Do you know Xie Lei? I'm his friend from America.
sentences.chinese: 对不起。你认识谢磊吗？我是他美国的朋友。

sentences.english: Objective To improve the performance level and awareness of CT imaging with brain abscess .
sentences.chinese: 目的提高对脑脓肿CT影像学表现的认识和诊断水平。

sentences.english: By recognizing the changing characteristics of your cervical mucus, you can predict when you'll ovulate.
sentences.chinese: 通过认识到宫颈粘液性状的改变，可以预测排卵时间。

sentences.english: However, the present recognition of TV essays still remains on the text-oriented level.
sentences.chinese: 但当前对电视散文的认识仍然停留在文本主导论层次。

sentences.english: 'The longer you've known someone, the easier that conversation is, ' Dr. Epperly adds.
sentences.chinese: 艾伯利医生说，你认识病患越久，这种对话就越容易。

sentences.english: As the lack of understanding of the disease, it's often misdiagnosed or missed diagnosis.
sentences.chinese: 由于对该疾病认识的不足，经常被误诊或者漏诊。

sentences.english: The other thing to realize is that all writers think they suck.
sentences.chinese: 另外一个要认识的事情是所有作家认为他们有所得。

sentences.english: Gibson has interviewed people to understand how they  conceptualize teams.
sentences.chinese: 吉布森调查了人们对于“团队合作”这一概念的认识。

sentences.english: You’re the most enigmatic person I know.
sentences.chinese: 你是我认识的人中最高深莫测的人。

sentences.english: The merchants realized that it was important to expand the clan influence if they wanted to get wealthy.
sentences.chinese: 商人认识到扩大宗族势力与自身致富有直接的关系。

sentences.english: From this viewpoint, globalisation is a kind of phenomenological tool for making sense of the world.
sentences.chinese: 从这个观点看，全球化是个认识世界现象的逻辑工具。

sentences.english: Global average temperature records are vital to understanding how the climate is changing.
sentences.chinese: 全球平均气温纪录对认识气候变化的过程至关重要。

sentences.english: One thing to realize, I told you the id is outrageously stupid.
sentences.chinese: 一件要认识的事情，我告诉你本我是非常的愚蠢的。

definition: to get to know each other/acquaintance
to be well acquainted with/to know well
to associate (with)/to have contact (with)/to hang out (with)/to date/(interpersonal) relationship/association/contact
to know/to become aware of/also pr. [zhi1 dao5]
to get to know sb/to meet sb for the first time
to be familiar with/to know well
good friend/(slang) a visit from Aunt Flo (menstrual period)
relation/relationship/to concern/to affect/to have to do with/guanxi/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 關係|关系[guan1 xi5]
